TEXT.citation: Early, R. J., & Whitehorn, J. (2003). One hundred Paiwan texts. Pacific Linguistics, Research School of Pacific and Asian Studies, The Australian National University.
TEXT.BibTeX_citation: @book{100paiwantexts, author = {Robert Early and John Whitehorn}, title = {One Hundred Paiwan Texts}, year = {2003}, publisher = {Pacific Linguistics, Research School of Pacific and Asian Studies, The Australian National University}}

S.FORM: izua ka tjaisangas tangapuł i Vutsuł, saka keman tua tsautsau sakamaya palalaut.
izoa ka tjaisangas tangapolj i Vocolj, saka keman toa caocao sakamaya palalaot.
S.TRANSL: Once upon a time there was a lion in the Vutsuł area, and it kept on eating people.

S.FORM: saka "aku tjen a uri maquang?
saka "ako tjen a ori maqoang?
S.TRANSL: They said: “We are going to be wiped out, aren’t we?

S.FORM: uri tja kudain sa tja sualapen a tangapuł?"
ori tja kodain sa tja soalapen a tangapolj?"
S.TRANSL: What are we going to do to get rid of this lion?”

S.FORM: qau djemauł tjai Tail kati Piri.
qao djemaolj tjai Tail kati Piri.
S.TRANSL: So they summoned Tail and Piri.

S.FORM: "kełu, selapay anga men; uri maquang amen tusa tangapuł."
"keljo, selapay anga men; ori maqoang amen tosa tangapolj."
S.TRANSL: “Come; we’re in trouble. We’re going to be wiped out by this lion”

S.FORM: vaik a sema zua tiamadju a maḍusa, kematsu tua vakela.
vaik a sema zoa tiamadjo a madrosa, kemaco toa vakela.
S.TRANSL: So the two went there, carrying (bows and) arrows.

S.FORM: "nu kemudakuda qadaw mangtjez a keman?"
"no kemodakoda qadaw mangtjez a keman?"
S.TRANSL: “At what time of day does it come to eat people?”

S.FORM: "nu i vavaw tsinedasan mangtjez."
"no i vavaw cinedasan mangtjez."
S.TRANSL: “It comes when the sun is above its rising place.”

S.FORM: kemałava tiamadju.
kemaljava tiamadjo.
ka mangtjez a tangapuł, panaqen sa papatsayin; saka maleva aravats tiamadju a Vutsuł.
ka mangtjez a tangapolj, panaqen sa papacayin; saka maleva aravac tiamadjo a Vocolj.
S.TRANSL: When the lion came, they shot and killed it. The Vutsuł people were very glad.

S.FORM: "uła timun anga kikazełuzełu tua imaza penułat."
"olja timon anga kikazeljozeljo toa imaza penoljat."
S.TRANSL: “All the tribute from here can go to you.”

S.FORM: qau vaik tiamadju a tsemikel a sema Tjuvasavasai.
qao vaik tiamadjo a cemikel a sema Tjovasavasai.
qau ti Łautu anga kisan qempuqepu tua kazełu i Vutsuł.
qao ti Ljaoto anga kisan qempoqepo toa kazeljo i Vocolj.
S.TRANSL: Łautu became the tribute collector among the Vutsuł.

S.FORM: nu patsatsikel tiamadju a pasa Vutsuł, kitsułu a sema zua tua qinałan anga tiamadju a maḍusa; mana palaingan nua naqałangan.
no pacacikel tiamadjo a pasa Vocolj, kicoljo a sema zoa toa qinaljan anga tiamadjo a madrosa; mana palaingan noa naqaljangan.
S.TRANSL: When the two travelled through there, feasts were given for them in every village, and they were the leaders of all the villages.
